fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, International co-operation and development, Enlargement, Energy, Environment, Regional Policy, Public Health, Food Safety, Transport, Climate Action

organisation_name: The South-East Europe Change Net Foundation (Fondacija Mreža za promjene Jugoistočne Evrope) (SEE Change Net)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
SEE Change Net Foundation is a Lead Partner in the Network for the SEE SEP Project funded by EC. SEE SEP, with 17 Partners and a number of Associates is by any definition a large network of actors. Number of person engaged in the Action is 49 in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Albania, Croatia, Italy, Kosovo, The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Montenegro and Serbia.  
 
Albania 
1. Environmental Center for Development Education and Networking (EDEN)    www.eden-al.org 
2. The Ekolevizja Group     www.ekolevizja.org 
 
Bosnia and Herzegovina 
3. Center for Environment/ Centar za zivotnu sredinu      www.czzs.org/ 
4. Public Interest Advocacy Center    www.cpi.ba 
 
Croatia 
5. DOOR - Društvo za oblikovanje održivog razvoja  
Society for Sustainable Development Design     www.door.hr 
6. Forum za slobodu odgoja/ Forum for Freedom in Education    www.fso.hr

9. Eko-svest    www.ekosvest.com.mk 
10. Environmental Citizens’ Association “Front 21/42”    www.front.org.mk

goals__remit:
SEE Change Net Foundation's goal is to support development of fact-based research and advocacy, for a South-East Europe change in policy and practice, towards more sustainable development in South-East Europe.  
As policy and investment decisions in the field of Energy (including Transport) and Food - and the economic policies which support them - account for 85% of all sustainability issues the organization wishes to focus over the next 10 years on the following 4 policy areas:  
1. energy 
2. people centered economic development 
3. transport 
4. food
